byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER

abstract: Delayed vote on nomination of Loretta E Lynch to succeed Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr as head of Justice Dept is putting Senate Republicans in bind, showing how difficult navigating politics will be for new Republican majority; Lynch is qualified and palatable to many Republicans, save for her support of Pres Obama's policies, yet holding up her confirmation leaves Republicans stuck with Holder, whom they despise.
lead_paragraph: Republicans can accept Loretta E. Lynch, a nominee they oppose because she backs the president’s policies, or reject her and live with an attorney general they loathe, Eric H. Holder Jr.

headline.main: In Delaying Vote on Loretta Lynch as Attorney General, G.O.P. Is in a Quandary
headline.print_headline: Attorney General Delay Puts G.O.P. in Quandary

snippet: Republicans can accept Loretta E. Lynch, a nominee they oppose because she backs the president’s policies, or reject her and live with an attorney general they loathe, Eric H. Holder Jr.
